intro: Phyteuma hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces cylindrical, ribbed seed capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Phyteuma hispanicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
